game_description: Get on your hoverboard and get ready to give your all in the toughest galactic sports! The first game where you can play using resistance bands! Train at your own pace: enter the TRAINING mode to test your skills and your physique at a level that suits you in order to progress. Test yourself: the MIX mode will make you find your limits in a progressive and long race where the circuits have INFINITE combinations and only the most experienced will reach the finish line. Learn from the best: take part in the ASYNC ONLINE mode to compare yourself with the best athlete of the week and watch his moves to beat him. Other features: - Procedural tracks and worlds, no race is the same in TRAINING and MIX modes. - Leaderboards in all game modes - Play at 90Hz Andromeda Sports is still under development.
review_1: I tried this with resistance bands hung over the top of a door as my pulleys. It didn't really work with hand tracking but by holding the controllers as well as the resistance bands it worked well. I wish it was possible to make the vehicle in the game moved faster! It has a f zero vibe but doesn't feel as fast. Also I wish it was possible to set the starting difficult of the level. If I'm already warmed up then the easier sections at the start make your workout inefficient.
review_2: Andromeda Sports is certainly an interesting game. However, it seems to have a tracking problem with the right hand. None of my right-hand hits registered in a challenge round, even though the tutorial had no problem with doing so. Regardless, this is a really innovative and interesting way of playing and using VR.
review_3: If you've played sprint vector before, this is the game that gives that same kind of feeling! This game has good skill expression complexity that gives you that urge to keep trying and keep getting higher scores after every run. I can see this game been extremely fun once the graphic gets more polishing (which honestly is the less stressful part of game development) The core game play is solid!
review_4: The game loop is fun and it gets you doing the enough exercise that you find yourself sweating after a while. Absolutely would recommend if you like speed games!!
review_5: Amazing game, I will soo try with an elastic band and write more, but generally it's really nice to exercise as all your body needs to move. Feels a bit like drifting.
